messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Files containing the handler implementations for POST /api/v0/lifecycle/configure:

- src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/LifecycleResources.java

Explanation:
- I searched the codebase for the configure endpoint and the operationId from openapi-configuration.json (configureNode). That led to src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/LifecycleResources.java.
- In that file the class-level annotation @Path("/api/v0/lifecycle") plus the method-level @Path("/configure") define the POST handlers for /api/v0/lifecycle/configure.
- The two handler methods are:
  - configureNodeJson(@QueryParam("profile") String profile, String config) — annotated @Consumes("application/json") (accepts JSON).
  - configureNode(@QueryParam("profile") String profile, String yaml) — annotated @Consumes({"application/yaml", "text/yaml"}) (accepts YAML).
- Both methods are marked @Hidden (the OpenAPI spec in src/main/resources/openapi-configuration.json documents the endpoint manually), but they are the actual runtime request handlers for the configure endpoint.
- I ignored tests and focused on source implementation files only.

files.description: List of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations.
files.title: Files
